paper_abstract: We extend the definition of binary threshold sequences from Fermat quotients to Euler quotients modulo p(r) with odd prime p and r >= 1. Under the condition of 2(p-1) not equivalent to 1 (mod p(2)), we present exact values of the linear complexity by defining cyclotomic classes modulo p(n) for all 1 <= n <= r. The linear complexity is very close to the period and is of desired value for cryptographic purpose. We also present a lower bound on the linear complexity for the case of 2(p-1) equivalent to 1 (mod p(2)). (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Linear complexity of binary sequences derived from Euler quotients with prime-power modulus
